Veigar (White Mage Veigar)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: November 29, 2012

Veigar, the Tiny Master of Evil, is a champion in the popular online game League of Legends. Known for his dark and sinister appearance, Veigar has captured the hearts of players with his powerful abilities and unique playstyle. However, in the alternate universe of skins, Veigar takes on a completely different persona as the White Mage Veigar.

White Mage Veigar is a skin that transforms Veigar into a benevolent and wise mage, clad in white robes and adorned with symbols of healing and protection. This skin offers players a chance to experience a different side of Veigar, one that is focused on support and healing rather than destruction.

Released on November 29, 2012, White Mage Veigar quickly became a fan favorite. Priced at 1350 RP, this skin offers a complete visual overhaul for Veigar, including new animations, spell effects, and voice lines. The attention to detail in this skin is truly remarkable, as every aspect of Veigar's appearance has been carefully crafted to fit the theme of a white mage.

Veigar's iconic black robes are replaced with flowing white robes, symbolizing purity and goodness. His staff, once a tool of destruction, is now a staff of healing, adorned with crystals and symbols of magic. Even his hat, a signature piece of Veigar's attire, has been transformed into a white mage's hat, complete with a wide brim and a golden trim.

But the changes don't stop at Veigar's appearance. White Mage Veigar also brings new spell effects to the table. His abilities, once dark and menacing, now radiate with healing energy. The dark clouds that once surrounded Veigar's Dark Matter ability are replaced with shimmering light, and his Event Horizon ability now creates a protective barrier of energy instead of a cage of darkness.

One of the most notable changes in White Mage Veigar is his voice lines. Veigar's usually sinister and sarcastic remarks are replaced with words of encouragement and support. Instead of taunting his enemies, White Mage Veigar offers words of healing and wisdom, reflecting his new role as a protector and healer.

Now, let's delve into the story of Veigar and how he fits into the world of League of Legends. Veigar, once a normal yordle, was transformed into a powerful mage by the dark sorcerer known as Mordekaiser. Imbued with dark magic, Veigar's powers grew exponentially, but at a great cost. His mind became twisted and consumed by thoughts of revenge and destruction.

In the game, Veigar is classified as a mage, specializing in burst damage and crowd control. His abilities revolve around manipulating dark energy and unleashing devastating spells upon his enemies. Veigar's passive ability, Phenomenal Evil Power, allows him to gain ability power every time he hits an enemy champion with an ability, making him stronger as the game progresses.

Veigar's Q ability, Baleful Strike, allows him to fire a bolt of dark energy at his enemies, dealing damage and granting him additional ability power if the target is killed. His W ability, Dark Matter, summons a meteor from the sky that crashes down on his enemies, dealing massive area of effect damage. Veigar's E ability, Event Horizon, creates a ring of dark energy that stuns enemies who pass through it, making it a powerful tool for crowd control.

Finally, Veigar's ultimate ability, Primordial Burst, unleashes a blast of dark energy that deals massive damage to a single target, scaling with the target's ability power. This ability is Veigar's signature move, capable of obliterating even the tankiest of champions if used correctly.

Veigar's strengths lie in his ability to burst down squishy targets and control team fights with his crowd control abilities. His burst damage potential is unmatched, and his ability to stun multiple enemies with Event Horizon can turn the tide of a battle. Additionally, Veigar's passive ability allows him to scale well into the late game, becoming a formidable force to be reckoned with.

However, Veigar also has his weaknesses. He is extremely squishy and lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. Additionally, Veigar's abilities have long cooldowns, meaning that he must carefully choose when to use them to maximize his damage output. Finally, Veigar's early game can be challenging, as he relies heavily on farming to gain ability power and become a threat.

In conclusion, White Mage Veigar is a visually stunning skin that offers players a chance to experience a different side of Veigar's character. With its intricate details, new spell effects, and revamped voice lines, this skin truly brings the white mage theme to life. Whether you're a fan of Veigar or simply looking for a new and unique skin, White Mage Veigar is a must-have for any League of Legends player.

For more information about Veigar and his various appearances, including White Mage Veigar, be sure to visit our page dedicated to Veigar on the League of Legends website. There, you can find detailed information, videos, and more to enhance your gaming experience.

Veigar (Astronaut Veigar)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: July 23, 2020

Veigar, the Tiny Master of Evil, has always been a mischievous and cunning champion in the League of Legends. With his dark and sinister powers, he has wreaked havoc on the battlefield, manipulating the very fabric of reality. However, in a surprising turn of events, Veigar has now set his sights on the vast expanse of space with his latest skin, Astronaut Veigar.

Astronaut Veigar is a visually stunning skin that takes the diminutive mage to new heights, quite literally. Clad in a futuristic astronaut suit, complete with a helmet and jetpack, Veigar is ready to explore the cosmos and unleash his cosmic powers upon his enemies. The skin features a sleek and modern design, with intricate details that showcase the attention to detail put into its creation.

One of the standout features of Astronaut Veigar is his ability effects. His abilities have been reimagined to fit the space theme, with his Q ability, Baleful Strike, now firing a laser beam instead of a dark energy bolt. His W ability, Dark Matter, summons a meteor from the sky, crashing down on unsuspecting foes. The E ability, Event Horizon, creates a swirling vortex of stars, trapping enemies within its gravitational pull. And finally, his ultimate ability, Primordial Burst, unleashes a devastating cosmic explosion upon his target.

But the visual upgrades don't stop there. Astronaut Veigar also has new recall animation, where he takes off into space, leaving a trail of stardust behind him. Additionally, his voice lines have been modified to match the space theme, with references to the vastness of the universe and his newfound cosmic powers.

Now, let's delve into the lore of Veigar and how he fits into the world of League of Legends. Veigar was once a normal yordle, living a peaceful life in Bandle City. However, his insatiable thirst for power led him down a dark path. He delved into forbidden magics, seeking to unlock the secrets of the universe. In his pursuit of ultimate power, Veigar made a pact with dark forces, forever altering his destiny.

Veigar's powers grew exponentially, but so did his lust for destruction. He became consumed by his desire to dominate and control, earning him the title of the Tiny Master of Evil. Veigar's abilities revolve around dark magic, allowing him to manipulate time and space, and bend reality to his will. He is a burst mage, capable of dealing massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time.

In the game, Veigar's strengths lie in his ability to burst down squishy targets with his high damage output. His Q ability, Baleful Strike, allows him to gain permanent ability power whenever he kills a unit with it, making him scale incredibly well into the late game. His E ability, Event Horizon, is a powerful crowd control tool that can stun multiple enemies, setting up devastating team fights. And his ultimate ability, Primordial Burst, deals massive damage to a single target, making him a formidable threat to any opponent.

However, Veigar also has his weaknesses. He is incredibly squishy and lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. His abilities also have relatively high mana costs, requiring careful resource management to maximize his damage output. Additionally, his Q ability has a short range, forcing him to get close to his enemies to deal damage.

Despite his weaknesses, Veigar has found his place in the League of Legends as a high-risk, high-reward champion. Skilled Veigar players can dominate the game, obliterating their enemies with their immense burst damage. His unique playstyle and satisfying abilities make him a favorite among players who enjoy playing mages.

On this page, you can find all the information and videos showcasing the various appearances of Veigar, including his base skin and other alternate skins. Whether you prefer the mischievous Astronaut Veigar or any of his other skins, you can explore the different looks and playstyles of this iconic champion.
